title: Mock Feature – User Profile Redesign
content:
We are undertaking a full redesign of the User Profile screen to enhance usability, visual hierarchy, and cross-platform consistency. The current design lacks modularity, and the layout fails to accommodate key features like identity verification, editable content, and responsive behavior on mobile and tablet devices.

The new layout introduces a profile header section prominently featuring the user's profile picture, full name, and verification badge (if applicable). Users can tap or click the profile photo to launch a modal-based image cropper that allows real-time adjustment before saving. Next to the name, a “Verified User” label will appear if verification is complete, or a “Get Verified” call-to-action will appear otherwise.

Below the header, we introduce a tabular icon layout to visually group secondary metadata:

  • Followers (icon + count)

  • Location (city + country)

  • Occupation

  • Email address (partially masked for privacy)

Each of these fields will have an edit icon (✎) for quick access to their respective edit modals.

Following the metadata section, the new design includes a dedicated bio section with expandable/collapsible long-form content. Bios exceeding 400 characters will be truncated with a "Show More" link. All text areas will adopt dynamic theming (light/dark mode), including adaptive font sizing for accessibility.

The entire layout is built using a 12-column responsive grid, ensuring full compatibility with:

  • 🖥️ Desktop (≥1024px)

  • 📱 Mobile (≤768px)

  • 🧾 Tablet (768px–1024px)

Additional visual changes include:

  • Rounded profile images (120px max diameter)

  • Ghost-style edit buttons (bordered, no fill)

  • Monospaced font for user handles

  • Verified badge styled using platform’s primary brand color

  • Tooltips on hover/tap for field descriptions

All components follow the company’s Atomic Design system guidelines and are fully supported by our Figma token set.

🛠️ MVP:

  • UI implementation for Web and iOS

  • Editable field behavior

  • Modal logic and responsive layout

  • Partial dark mode theming
